greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(1) = 1, a(lucky(n)) = prime(a(n-1)), a(unlucky(n)) = composite(a(n)), where lucky(n) = n-th lucky number A000959, unlucky(n) = n-th unlucky number A050505, and prime = A000040, composite = A002808.
comment: In other words, a(1) = 1 and for n > 1, if n is the k-th lucky number larger than 1 [i.e., n = A000959(k+1)] then a(n) = nthprime(a(k)), otherwise, when n is the k-th unlucky number [i.e., n = A050505(k)], then a(n) = nthcomposite(a(k)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of other permutations:
xref: Related or similar permutations: A246378, A255422, A257725, A257734.
